subject: Medicine
title: Euthanasia and Assisted Dying
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Euthanasia and Assisted Dying.

hook.text: A terminal patient begs to die. They're in agony with weeks to live. Should a doctor help them end their suffering?

buildup.text: Euthanasia means a doctor ends a patient's life. Assisted dying means providing the means for the patient to do so.

discovery.text: A growing number of countries allow some form of assisted dying for terminal patients with unbearable suffering.

twist.text: Opponents fear a slippery slopeâ€”that eligibility could expand to include people who aren't terminally ill.

climax.text: The debate pits compassion against the fear of abuse: ending suffering versus protecting vulnerable people.

punchline.text: Mercy and caution must walk the same path.

quiz.question: What is the main concern of opponents of assisted dying?
options: Eligibility could expand beyond terminal illness over time
All doctors would be forced to perform euthanasia
No patients actually want to end their lives
